$$

$$

so essencially they do toway fixed effectss.

Bacon decomp shows toway fixed effects estimator as a weighted average of all potential 2x2 DD estimates where weights are both based on group sizes and variaance in treatment,.

- Under variance weighted common trends and time invariant treatemnt effects the variance weighted ATT is a weighted average of all possible ATTs, and under more restrictive assumptions it matches perfectly ATT.
- But with time varying tratment effects there can be bias
- Moment of the treatment influences the numerical value you get when twoway fixed effects are used to estimate the ATT. Because it changes the model variance, with 0.5 driving the biggest variance.
- twoway fixed effects with differential timing weights the 2Ã—2s comparing the two ultimate treatment groups more if the gap in treatment time is close to 0.5.
